The peel of the grapefruit has a bitter taste, which is due to the presence of organic acids, including malic acid, which contribute to its sourness. The white part of the grapefruit is typically the least flavored, while the yellow part has the largest amount of segments. The grapefruit is a popular fruit in many cultures, and is a key ingredient in many desserts.
